comments.body: this looks weird until you [look up fixed](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String/fixed) and find out that it's actually a deprecated member of String.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +88,92 @@    fn5 `${ (n) => n.toFixed() }`; // will error; 'n' should have type 'string'.
                     ~~~~~~~
!!! error TS2551: Property 'toFixed' does not exist on type 'string'. Did you mean 'fixed'?
    fn5 `${ (n) => n.substr(0) }`;
